output_list.criticism: The function AzurionToken constructor has an integer overflow vulnerability. The totalSupply variable is assigned the value of initialSupply, which could potentially lead to an integer overflow if the initialSupply is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in the uint256 data type.

The function _transfer has an integer overflow vulnerability. The balanceOf[_to] += _value line could potentially lead to an integer overflow if the sum of balanceOf[_to] and _value is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in the uint256 data type.

The function transferFrom has an integer overflow vulnerability. The allowance[_from][msg.sender] -= _value line could potentially lead to an integer overflow if the difference between allowance[_from][msg.sender] and _value is negative.

The function mintToken has an integer overflow vulnerability. The totalSupply += mintedAmount line could potentially lead to an integer overflow if the sum of totalSupply and mintedAmount is greater than the maximum value that can be stored in the uint256 data type.
The function burnFrom has an integer overflow vulnerability. The totalSupply -= _value line could potentially lead to an integer overflow if the difference between totalSupply and _value is negative.
